description: Form makes visible the invisible. It transforms a point into an inkblot, or an arrow, or a musical note. By separating forms from its concepts, we may create a myriad of expressions on a single concept, or apply a unified style to various concepts. The Form class provides basic method to draw points, lines, and other primitives on CanvasSpace. Extend this class to visualize in different ways in different contexts.

funcs.description: Create a new Form which is based on HTML Canvass
funcs.name: Form
param: space A space that has a valid context for this form. In this case, the space should represent an html canvas.

funcs.name: fill
param: c fill color which can be as color, gradient, or pattern. (See canvas documentation) Default is false (transparent)

funcs.name: stroke
param: c stroke color which can be as color, gradient, or pattern. (See canvas documentation) Default is false (transparent)
width Optional value (can be floating point) to set line width
joint Optional string to set line joint style. Can be "miter", "bevel", or "round".

funcs.name: font
param: size an integer value to specify font size in pixels
face optional name to change the font face, such as "sans-serif" or "Helvetica"

funcs.description: Draw a shape. Defaults to sketch(). Override this function to draw differently.

param: shape any shape such as Point or Line, or an array of Points

funcs.name: point

param: p a Point to specify anchor position
